intro: Richea pandanifolia subsp. pandanifolia, commonly known as the pandan-like richea, is a shrub native to New Zealand. It is characterized by its dense, leathery foliage that resembles the leaves of the pandanus plant, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows in coastal and rocky habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. Its leaves are often used in traditional Māori practices, including basket weaving and as a source of fiber. The species is notable for its adaptability to harsh environmental conditions and its ecological importance in native ecosystems.
